projects.name: Increased resilience of mountain ecosystems, flagship species and communities to climate change through climate-smart conservation and ecosystem-based adaptation
projects.description: A new ecological corridor of around 800,000 hectares, or 8,000 km², has been announced by the Kyrgyz Republic on 22 May 2025. The corridor is set to link up existing conservation areas and complete a protected area spanning a total of over 1,2 million hectares, in a landmark move for biodiversity. As the largest protected area of its kind in the country, it will enable snow leopards and their prey to better adapt to climate change. Also, grazing density will be reduced by almost one quarter, in

projects.name: Strengthening science-policy interface for DRR and providing scientific advice related to geohazards mitigation
projects.description: Kyrgyzstan is highly exposed and vulnerable to a wide range of natural hazards, including earthquakes, landslides, mudflows and floods, which are increasingly exacerbated by climate change. Glacier melting and formation of glacial lakes have significantly increased the risk of Glacier Lake Outburst Floods (GLOFs), posing serious threats to mountain communities, infrastructure, livelihoods and ecosystems. projects.description: Kyrgyzstan is facing growing water management challenges driven by climate change, population growth and the need to ensure food and energy security. Changes in glacier melt and seasonal water availability are affecting both rural and urban communities, while shared river systems add further complexity to water governance. projects.name: Bridging the digital health divide
projects.description: This Joint Programme (JP) aims to strengthen Kyrgyzstan’s digital health information system (d-HIS) by: i) enhancing equal quality healthcare provision through a national, integrated digital health information system; ii) promoting inclusive, integrated, and equal service provision to women and men at the intersection of healthcare and social protection; and iii) increasing access to quality Primary Healthcare (PHC) services to rural and remote areas for mothers and children.

projects.description: Kyrgyzstan is characterized by rich biodiversity and geodiversity. This sub-output will support national efforts to conserve biodiversity and sustainably manage geological resources by strengthening capacities of relevant institutions, local authorities and communities.
